subject: Physical Fitness
title: Cold Water Immersion
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cold Water Immersion usable.

hook.text: Athletes sit in ice baths and grimace. It hurts, it's cold, and the science is more complex than you'd think.

buildup.text: Cold water constricts blood vessels, reduces swelling, and numbs pain â€” providing immediate relief.

discovery.text: For acute recovery between same-day events, cold water immersion genuinely helps reduce fatigue.

twist.text: After strength training, it may blunt muscle growth. Cold reduces the inflammation needed for adaptation.

climax.text: Use ice baths for competition recovery, not regular training. The short-term relief costs long-term gains.

punchline.text: Ice baths help you recover fast. But fast recovery isn't always better recovery.

quiz.question: Why might ice baths after strength training be counterproductive?
options: They reduce inflammation needed for muscle adaptation and growth
